International Student Affairs Office
Kuwait
Home / Sponsored Students / Kuwait
We make it a priority to assist our Kuwaiti-sponsored students and to make the transition to life at UMKC and in the United States as easy as possible.
SPONSORED STUDENTS
Kuwait
Oman
Saudi Arabia
Sponsor Information
Welcome to UMKC!
Congratulations on receiving a scholarship from the Embassy of Kuwait! Because you are sponsored by the Embassy of Kuwait, there are specific instructions to follow and requirements to meet.
Financial guarantees
A financial guarantee from the Embassy of Kuwait is required for us to bill the embassy for your tuition and fees. Typically, your advisor at the Embassy of Kuwait will send your financial guarantee directly to our sponsored student officer. If you are receiving bills from the Cashiers Office saying you have unpaid tuition, request a copy of your financial guarantee and email it to our sponsored student officer, Morgan Ramsey.
Check-in
When you arrive in Kansas City, you will need to schedule a check-in session through Online Services. Bring passports, student visa, I-20s, I-94s and a local address to your check-in session.
Consent form
A Consent Form (PDF) is required for sponsored students because UMKC needs permission from the student to issue student information to a sponsoring agency. You will be asked to complete a consent form at your check-in session.
International Student Orientation
The mandatory International Student Orientation is usually held on the Tuesday before classes start. Failure to attend orientation will result in a hold on your account, which prevents you from enrolling in future semesters. The only way to remove this hold is to attend another orientation.
English evaluation
Students who are conditionally admitted to UMKC will be required to take an English evaluation at the Applied Language Institute upon arrival. This evaluation will determine what level of ESL courses might be required.
Health insurance
All new international students are automatically enrolled in UMKC’s student health insurance program. Because Kuwaiti-sponsored students and their dependents receive insurance through the Embassy of Kuwait, you do not need to have this student insurance. To avoid being automatically charged for UMKC health insurance, please complete a Health Insurance Waiver (PDF) and turn it in during your check-in session.
Enrollment
When you have completed your check-in session and English evaluation, if needed, you can meet with an academic advisor to begin selecting courses. It is your responsibility to make sure you are enrolled full time (undergraduate: 12 credit hours, graduate: nine credit hours).
Kuwaiti-sponsored students are not permitted to enroll in online, evening, weekend, accelerated PACE or Arabic language courses without special permission from the Embassy of Kuwait. If an academic advisor discusses online courses during the course selection process, it is your responsibility to explain to the academic advisor that you are unable to enroll in online courses due to scholarship restrictions.
Late enrollment fees are not covered by the Embassy of Kuwait.
Please review the Kuwait MOHE Rules and Regulations for more information.
Change of major
If you wish to change your major you must first get approval from your advisor at the Embassy of Kuwait. If your advisor at the Embassy of Kuwait approves the change of major, you will receive a new financial guarantee which you must submit to us.
Student housing
There are a variety of living arrangements available to students. If you would like to learn more about on-campus housing, please review the information provided by Residential Life.

Change of major
If you wish to change your major you must first get approval from your advisor at the Embassy of Kuwait. If your advisor at the Embassy of Kuwait approves the change of major, you will receive a new financial guarantee which you must submit to us.
Student housing
There are a variety of living arrangements available to students. If you would like to learn more about on-campus housing, please review the information provided by Residential Life.

UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI-KANSAS CITY
search

International Student Affairs Office
Saudi Arabia
Home / Sponsored Students / Saudi Arabia
We make it a priority to assist our Saudi Arabian Cultural Mission (SACM)-sponsored students and to make the transition to life at UMKC and in the United States as easy as possible.
SPONSORED STUDENTS
Kuwait
Oman
Saudi Arabia
Sponsor Information
Welcome to UMKC!
We are excited that you have chosen to attend UMKC and look forward to meeting you on campus. 
We understand the importance of a scholarship from SACM, and we're here to answer your questions about sponsorship and enrollment.
Financial guarantees
A financial guarantee from SACM is required in order to receive full admission and an I-20 form from UMKC. These are provided to students by SACM only after meeting these conditions.
The student has submitted proof of eligibility for a SACM sponsorship (generally through a For Admissions Purposes Only letter)
UMKC provides the student with a pre-admit letter to be given to SACM in return for the financial guarantee
Check-in session
When you arrive in Kansas City, you will need to schedule a check-in session through Online Services. Bring passports, scholarship award letters, I-20s, I-94s and a local address to your check-in session.
Consent Form
The Consent Form is a release of certain FERPA rights to UMKC, allowing the sharing of information between SACM and UMKC. Admitted students will be expected to complete a consent form at check-in.
International Student Orientation
The mandatory International Student Orientation is always held on the Tuesday before classes start. Failure to attend orientation will result in a hold on your account, which prevents you from enrolling in future semesters. The only way to remove this hold is to attend another orientation.
English evaluation
Students placed at UMKC for academic coursework who have TOEFL scores of less than 100 iBT or IELTS scores of less than 6.5 will be required to take an English evaluation at the Applied Language Institute upon arrival.
ESL courses
Those who are coming for short-term English studies will be taking ESL courses at our Applied Language Institute. Failure to complete the ESL coursework in the allotted time will prevent you from being released into academic coursework.
SACM will pay for up to two academic years of English classes. Further enrollment in ALI must be paid by the student.
Enrollment
When students have completed the check-in session and their English evaluation, if needed, they can meet with an academic advisor to begin selecting and enrolling in courses. It is the student’s responsibility to make sure they are enrolled full time (undergraduate: 12 credit hours, graduate: nine credit hours).
You are not permitted to enroll in online, evening or Arabic language courses without special permission from SACM. If an academic advisor discusses online courses during the course selection process, it is your responsibility to explain to the academic advisor that you are unable to enroll in online courses due to scholarship restrictions.
Late enrollment fees are not covered by SACM.
Change of major
SACM has approved students for scholarships based on the major for which they have applied. If you wish to change your major, you must first get approval from your SACM advisor. If your SACM advisor approves the change of major, you will receive a new financial guarantee which you should submit to ISAO.
Health insurance
All new international students are automatically enrolled in UMKC’s health insurance program. SACM-sponsored students and their dependents receive insurance through SACM. To avoid automatic charges for UMKC health insurance, complete a Health Insurance Waiver (PDF) and turn it in during your check-in session.
Student housing
A student cannot submit a housing contract without an SSO or UMKC ID.

If your SACM advisor approves the change of major, you will receive a new financial guarantee which you should submit to ISAO.
Health insurance
All new international students are automatically enrolled in UMKC’s health insurance program. SACM-sponsored students and their dependents receive insurance through SACM. To avoid automatic charges for UMKC health insurance, complete a Health Insurance Waiver (PDF) and turn it in during your check-in session.
Student housing
A student cannot submit a housing contract without an SSO or UMKC ID.

International Student Affairs Office
Saudi Arabia
Home / Sponsored Students / Saudi Arabia

SPONSORED STUDENTS
Kuwait
Oman
Saudi Arabia
Sponsor Information
Welcome to UMKC!
We are excited that you have chosen to attend UMKC and look forward to meeting you on campus. 
We understand the importance of a scholarship from SACM, and we're here to answer your questions about sponsorship and enrollment.
Financial guarantees
A financial guarantee from SACM is required in order to receive full admission and an I-20 form from UMKC. These are provided to students by SACM only after meeting these conditions.
The student has submitted proof of eligibility for a SACM sponsorship (generally through a For Admissions Purposes Only letter)
UMKC provides the student with a pre-admit letter to be given to SACM in return for the financial guarantee
Check-in session
When you arrive in Kansas City, you will need to schedule a check-in session through Online Services. Bring passports, scholarship award letters, I-20s, I-94s and a local address to your check-in session.
Consent Form
The Consent Form is a release of certain FERPA rights to UMKC, allowing the sharing of information between SACM and UMKC. Admitted students will be expected to complete a consent form at check-in.
International Student Orientation
The mandatory International Student Orientation is always held on the Tuesday before classes start. Failure to attend orientation will result in a hold on your account, which prevents you from enrolling in future semesters. The only way to remove this hold is to attend another orientation.
English evaluation
Students placed at UMKC for academic coursework who have TOEFL scores of less than 100 iBT or IELTS scores of less than 6.5 will be required to take an English evaluation at the Applied Language Institute upon arrival.
ESL courses
Those who are coming for short-term English studies will be taking ESL courses at our Applied Language Institute. Failure to complete the ESL coursework in the allotted time will prevent you from being released into academic coursework.
SACM will pay for up to two academic years of English classes. Further enrollment in ALI must be paid by the student.
Enrollment
When students have completed the check-in session and their English evaluation, if needed, they can meet with an academic advisor to begin selecting and enrolling in courses. It is the student’s responsibility to make sure they are enrolled full time (undergraduate: 12 credit hours, graduate: nine credit hours).
You are not permitted to enroll in online, evening or Arabic language courses without special permission from SACM. If an academic advisor discusses online courses during the course selection process, it is your responsibility to explain to the academic advisor that you are unable to enroll in online courses due to scholarship restrictions.
Late enrollment fees are not covered by SACM.
Change of major
SACM has approved students for scholarships based on the major for which they have applied. If you wish to change your major, you must first get approval from your SACM advisor. If your SACM advisor approves the change of major, you will receive a new financial guarantee which you should submit to ISAO.
Health insurance
All new international students are automatically enrolled in UMKC’s health insurance program. SACM-sponsored students and their dependents receive insurance through SACM. To avoid automatic charges for UMKC health insurance, complete a Health Insurance Waiver (PDF) and turn it in during your check-in session.
Student housing
A student cannot submit a housing contract without an SSO or UMKC ID.

https://www.umkc.edu/isao/sponsored-stud.content:
UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI-KANSAS CITY
search

International Student Affairs Office
Saudi Arabia
Home / Sponsored Students / Saudi Arabia
We make it a priority to assist our Saudi Arabian Cultural Mission (SACM)-sponsored students and to make the transition to life at UMKC and in the United States as easy as possible.
SPONSORED STUDENTS
Kuwait
Oman
Saudi Arabia
Sponsor Information
Welcome to UMKC!
We are excited that you have chosen to attend UMKC and look forward to meeting you on campus. 
We understand the importance of a scholarship from SACM, and we're here to answer your questions about sponsorship and enrollment.
Financial guarantees
A financial guarantee from SACM is required in order to receive full admission and an I-20 form from UMKC. These are provided to students by SACM only after meeting these conditions.
The student has submitted proof of eligibility for a SACM sponsorship (generally through a For Admissions Purposes Only letter)
UMKC provides the student with a pre-admit letter to be given to SACM in return for the financial guarantee
Check-in session
When you arrive in Kansas City, you will need to schedule a check-in session through Online Services. Bring passports, scholarship award letters, I-20s, I-94s and a local address to your check-in session.
Consent Form
The Consent Form is a release of certain FERPA rights to UMKC, allowing the sharing of information between SACM and UMKC. Admitted students will be expected to complete a consent form at check-in.
International Student Orientation
The mandatory International Student Orientation is always held on the Tuesday before classes start. Failure to attend orientation will result in a hold on your account, which prevents you from enrolling in future semesters. The only way to remove this hold is to attend another orientation.
English evaluation
Students placed at UMKC for academic coursework who have TOEFL scores of less than 100 iBT or IELTS scores of less than 6.5 will be required to take an English evaluation at the Applied Language Institute upon arrival.
ESL courses
Those who are coming for short-term English studies will be taking ESL courses at our Applied Language Institute. Failure to complete the ESL coursework in the allotted time will prevent you from being released into academic coursework.
SACM will pay for up to two academic years of English classes. Further enrollment in ALI must be paid by the student.
Enrollment
When students have completed the check-in session and their English evaluation, if needed, they can meet with an academic advisor to begin selecting and enrolling in courses. It is the student’s responsibility to make sure they are enrolled full time (undergraduate: 12 credit hours, graduate: nine credit hours).
You are not permitted to enroll in online, evening or Arabic language courses without special permission from SACM. If an academic advisor discusses online courses during the course selection process, it is your responsibility to explain to the academic advisor that you are unable to enroll in online courses due to scholarship restrictions.
Late enrollment fees are not covered by SACM.
Change of major
SACM has approved students for scholarships based on the major for which they have applied. If you wish to change your major, you must first get approval from your SACM advisor. If your SACM advisor approves the change of major, you will receive a new financial guarantee which you should submit to ISAO.
Health insurance
All new international students are automatically enrolled in UMKC’s health insurance program. SACM-sponsored students and their dependents receive insurance through SACM. To avoid automatic charges for UMKC health insurance, complete a Health Insurance Waiver (PDF) and turn it in during your check-in session.
Student housing
A student cannot submit a housing contract without an SSO or UMKC ID.
